definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Webcomics (comics only on the web, making money through printing books and other things) are pretty popular in the U. S. Do you think that could be popular in China?
sentences.chinese: 中国网上漫画一样很火，也有从网上火到出书赚钱的。

sentences.english: You will then be a “published” author!
sentences.chinese: 这样你就算得上一个“出书”作家了。

sentences.english: That part of his life, writing books, apparently was a dream deferred.
sentences.chinese: 出书，显然是他少年未完成的一个梦。

sentences.english: Victory in the heart of LiuJianMin cast money for beautiful things from the book.
sentences.chinese: 胜利心中还对刘建民给美丽投钱出书的事耿耿于怀。

sentences.english: Mr Qin wrote a thick book on history and it was published last year.
sentences.chinese: 秦先死写了一本有闭历史的薄薄的书，客岁出书了。

sentences.english: Book life and work life are two separate things.
sentences.chinese: 出书生涯和工作生涯是两件分离的事情。

sentences.english: You don't need money to be a publisher.
sentences.chinese: 你并不需要钱以成为一名出书人。

sentences.english: Since the book, Bush participated in many TV show for the book campaign trail.
sentences.chinese: 出书以来，小布什参加多档电视节目为新书宣传造势。

sentences.english: She also wanted to experiment with self-publishing.
sentences.chinese: 她也想尝试一下自助出书。

sentences.english: If I was not misremembered, that phase is network novel give the time with best book.
sentences.chinese: 假如我没记错，那阶段正是网络小说出书最好的时光。

sentences.english: Literary history is finally gave Yang ink green book, excited Yang green ink.
sentences.chinese: 文史馆终于要给杨墨青出书了，让杨墨青兴奋不已。

definition: person who writes articles - newspapers, magazines, blogs (informal)/scribe/copyist/a talented writer of articles or of calligraphy
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
